page.title: 12MICHAELCHURCH POST OFFICE.
page.content: Stepping into the Post Office at Michaelchurch is like stepping back in time.It still has the{original {shelving and effects}from when it was one of the two shops in the village.Then it was called "Mill House" and at the rear of the house you can still see the{old bread oven } which 3 times a day baked 30x4lb and 6x2lb loaves.This oven used wood or gorse to heat it. Back in 1935 the owner bought up "Church Cottage" ,a hardware and haberdashery shop,in order to close down local competition for trade. Today its main trade comes through the{postal services}it offers. A few foodstuffs,especially{sweets,}are kept but it is not by any stretch of the imagination a village grocery shop.The present Postmistress,Mrs.Smith has lived in the area for 36 years.
